brute_force_rendering_culling.detail.asy:
Asynchronously updates visible chunks in a separate thread and synchronizes with the main rendering thread. 
This can accelerate chunk loading speed during movement and improve frame rates.

You can increase the number of threads for loading blocks in the game settings to assist with this functionality. 
In the testing phase, if the game crashes during chunk loading, please try turning off this setting.
brute_force_rendering_culling.detail.sam:
The scaling ratio of the depth texture used for culling. The higher the ratio, the more accurate the culling and the better the effect.

If increasing the ratio has no negative impact on frame rate, it can be increased as much as possible. Not recommended to be below 20%.
brute_force_rendering_culling.detail.cul:
The number of frames delayed before the culling texture is updated to the CPU, preventing main thread stutter caused by incomplete data transmission. 
When the value is high, the block flickering phenomenon caused by rotating the field of view will become more severe.

Debug by observing culling map update times. 
Enabling shaders will slow down data transmission, resulting in at least 1 frame delay.
brute_force_rendering_culling.detail.che: For testing purposes, enables checking of depth and culling texture functionality when the data monitoring panel is open.
brute_force_rendering_culling.detail.deb: For testing purposes, effective only in vanilla Minecraft, used to view culled chunks.
brute_force_rendering_culling.detail.nvi: warn:Incompatible with Nvidium's Async bfs feature
